Dynamic Languages Symposium (DLS)

Dynamic Languages Symposium 2018  

Co-located with SPLASH 2018

In association with ACM SIGPLAN

Boston, Massachusetts, USA, November 6, 2018

2018.splashcon.org/track/dls-2018
http://www.dynamic-languages-symposium.org/dls-18/

  • Most Notable Paper Award 2018 for 2008
    • Recipients: Jeremy Siek and Manish Vachharajani
    • Title: Gradual Typing with Unification-based Inference
    • Conference: DLS 2008
    • Paper: https://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=1408688
    • Citation: The 2008 DLS paper “Gradual Typing with Unification-based Inference” showed that one can increase the static guarantees made in a program through an ingenious combination of gradual typing and unification-base type inference. The ideas underlying this paper have found their way into the design of many modern programming languages, and have had a strong impact on the research community.
    • Certificate: pdf
  • DLS 2018 papers available for download from the ACM Digital Library!

It is our great pleasure to welcome you to Boston for the 2018 edition of the Dynamic Languages Symposium! This year’s symposium – the 14th in the se- ries – continues the tradition of communicating research results in the design, implementation, and application of dynamic languages.

We are happy that high quality research around dynamic languages continues. Out of a total of 20 submissions, the program committee accepted 8 papers whose topics range from semantics and formalism, over optimization and compilation of systems and languages, to research into full programming systems.

This year, each paper received a minimum of 3 reviews and 4 papers received a second round of reviews after substantial updates in response to reviewer comments were made to the papers.

Beyond the formal program, we hope this year’s DLS will, like its predecessors, be a valuable forum for sharing ideas with other dynamic language researchers and practitioners from institutions around the world. Thank you for being part of this exciting community, and once again, welcome!

We warmly thank the Program Committee, the SPLASH organization, the authors, and, last but not least, the audience.

Tim Felgentreff
DLS 2018 Program Chair
Oracle Labs
Germany
